Dreadplague: Then I would like to become one of your pupil too, if 
you would allow me. I had no real training as an airborne warrior 
apart from my initial programming.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> : : DeathStar : :
> 
> DeathStar: I did a bit of fighting, but I was mostly responsible 
for training our flyers. Darkangel was one of my students.
> 
> 
> Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> In chopper mode, Dreadplague led the way. The signatures were 
located 
> on the flanks of a mountainous area. At first sight, they were 
> transformers... but were they really?
> 
> Dreadplague: Deathstar, what did you do before coming here? Did you 
> fight in the Cybertron Campaign?
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
wrote:
> > : : Darkangel/DeathStar : :
> > 
> > Darkangel smiled behind his faceplate, taking pride in being 
named 
> sub-commander. He winked at Dreadplague before she left, then 
quickly 
> followed Commander Tyrael.
> > 
> > Darkangel: I take it you theory spell possible doom for us all?
> > 
> > DeathStar walked along side Dreadplague.
> > 
> > DeathStar: There was, but I'm unsure of what has come of him.
> > 
> > Once outside the base, DeathStar changed to starfighter mode, 
> flying towards the unknown signatures.
> > 
> > 
> > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > Tyrael: I have a vague hypothesis... too fearsome to speak of 
here. 
> I 
> > don't want to believe in it, but it seems to be the only one 
> > possible...
> > 
> > He stopped. His face was grave and his eyes showed fear. The Blue 
> > Phoenix, afraid?!
> > 
> > Tyrael: Dreadplague, Deathstar, go investigate the two signatures 
> at 
> > these coordinates. If they are hostiles, do NOT engage. I want 
only 
> > data for now. Darkangel, I need your assistance and your advice. 
> You 
> > are now officially my Second in command. Follow me please.
> > 
> > He left the room and went to the lab.
> > 
> > Dreadplague was wide eyed.
> > 
> > Dreadplague: Congratulations, Angel! We'll have to celebrate when 
I 
> > come back... (she had said that low enough that only Darkangel 
had 
> > heard) Come Deathstar. Let's do this and be done. Oh, by the way, 
> > wasn't there someone with you?
> > 
> >
